alert.note: Alert for Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Lawrence County through NOON EDT... At 1058 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fowler, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on roadways could be a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Cranberry Lake, Degrasse, Russell, Fine, Stark, Edwards, Lower Oswegatchie, Fullerville, Newton Falls, Talcville, South Edwards, and South Russell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southeastern St. Lawrence; Southwestern St. Lawrence
